newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end quietly steady.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end quietly steady.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended quietly steady in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest despite a small hike in the interbank rate, dealers said on Monday.

"Government securities were quietly steady except for some light activity in the three-months treasury bill. The interbank rate rose slightly today but there was little impact on the market. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months ended at a yield of 1.03/0.98 percent compared with last Friday's yield of 1.00/0.95 percent.
One-year treasury bills was unchanged against last Friday's yield of 1.50/1.45 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 was unchanged from last Friday's close of S$99.15/99.20, September 2001 unchanged at S$97.35/97.40 and June 2003 unchanged at S$95.35/95.40.
The overnight interbank offered rate rose to 3-1/4 3-1/8 percent versus last Friday's 3-1/8 3 percent.
